article_title: Small Stocks Could Be Getting Too Expensive, This Adviser Says
article_text:
In terms of valuations, small-company stocks are looking pricey compared with their larger peers. And that has Brad Bickham, an investment adviser in Boulder, Colo., wary.

"We think that the valuation of small cap relative to large cap has gotten a bit stretched," says Mr. Bickham, chairman and chief investment officer of financial advisory firm Sargent Bickham Lagudis LLC.

Historically, the average price/earnings...

twitter.description: Small-stock valuations are getting stretched, Sargent Bickham Lagudis's Brad Bickham says; he is ready to sell if they get more expensive.
twitter.title: Small Stocks Could Be Getting Too Cocky

image.alt: If small stocks' already stretched valuations get higher, this top adviser says he might sell.
